noun.description: A person who or thing which revives, renews, or restores something; a reviver.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in Robert Barnes (c1495–1540), religious reformer. From revive + -or<br>early 17th century (in an earlier sense). Apparently alteration of reviver (although this is first attested slightly later). For a similar phenomenon, compare some forms retainer.
